H0.text: The law of independent assortment supports the statement that the biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing to do with the selection of the allele for another trait.

H1.text: The law of dominance supports the statement that biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing to do with the selection of the allele for another trait.

H2.text: The law of segregation supports the statement that the biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing to do with the selection of the allele for another trait.

H3.text: The law of recessiveness supports the assertion that the biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing to do with the selection of the allele for another trait.
